My thoughts:

Agreed that those champs aren't freelo. People don't know what it is. It might look easy to win with LeBlanc and co but as irritating (and strong, wouldn't get used in the LCS otherwise) as they are, they're simply not guaranteed wins and you're right, you'd have an easier time winning with Malzahar or Katarina or Jinx right now.

Disagree that popularity doesn't affect win rate, it's just that it's not the sole factor. Looking into the examples - lots of people play Zed without actually trying to learn his mechanics very well and then get destroyed by people who are actually competent with their champ. Lots of people play Jinx and because she's honestly rather easy to play they are much more likely to do well. Popularity definitely affects win rate but it's not the only factor - ease of picking up is another obvious factor in win rates which allows some popular champs to have much higher win rates than others.
Also you are forgetting all those people who are first pick and instalock LeBlanc (i.e.), then you just have to pick a counter (Galio, i.e.) and you win the lane easily. No kills on LeBlanc = 5v4.

Azir top + Kassadin mid + Veigar support

get the freelo while it's hot boys
Don't forget Kalista ADC and Zac Jungle

This guy gets it.

These "Freelo" champions aren't actually good, just very annoying to lane against. In order to be freelo, a champion must have 50%+ winrate regardless of popularity.

....... Yeah.  If you can't hit a skillshot, you are bad at the game and we aren't balancing around you.  Sorry.

Ahri has 2 straight-line skillshots, a dash, and a press and forget proximity ability.  Simplest freaking kit in the world.  There ain't no fancy combos there to confuse you, or anything that takes particular skill to pull off.

Jinx has 3 skillshots and a toggle on her auto attacks.  Again, assuming you have the bare minimum skill required for your opinion to be of any worth when it comes to balance, one of the simplest kits a champion can have.

Meanwhile, while I consider the bar it sets to still be quite low, Kalista's passive actually requires a minimal level of micromanagement that might be difficult for some players.

Jinx is a pretty easy champion if you play marksmen often, one or two games and you get the basics.
Ahri just has a "Press Q to escape" mechanic that allows her to forgive every mistake she makes, so she just has to keep herself alive until she has an opportunity to kill someone.
Lee Sin has no real weaknesses, his early game is abusive (admittedly by RIOT) and, even if he's not OP, he's a extremely annoying champion to play against.
Kalista is just the worst designed champion ever along with Darius, playing against her is just suffering for 30 minutes if the Kalista player can actually play her (especially if you are played a melee or skillshot-based ranged: basically everyone not called Lissandra).
Honestly, you have a better chance with Malzahar, Fiora, and Sejunai being on your team then any of the popular champions right now.

No reasonable person who has a clue about the game would call any champion "Freelo," because no champion is so overpowered that it means more than skill. Even if such a champion existed, you wouldn't always get it first AND it would almost certainly be permabanned.

Now that that's out of the way, some of these are genuinely overpowered, some simply have **abysmal** designs. I'll get downvoted for this, but LeBlanc's concept simply shouldn't exist. MASSIVE mobility, CC and .6 second combo time megabursting? I don't care if she's overpowered or not, that is a silly design.

The last thing I'd like to point out is that people frequently confuse design and balance, and therefore call poorly designed champions overpowered. I don't think they should be nerfed, I think they need to be reworked. That kind of concept **shouldn't** be salvaged. She should have a specialty and stick to it, for example.
